row.column: Overview of Construction Processes Acumatica ERP Construction Edition includes the following functionality: Project accounting by cost codes. The cost codes functionality is available if the Cost Codes feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Project change management. The change orders functionality is available if the Change Orders feature is enabled on the on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Stored material tracking in project pro forma invoices. The functionality is available if the Construction feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Retainage support. The following functionality is available if the Retainage Support feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form: Ability to account for retainage in commitments (purchase orders and subcontracts) and in Accounts Payable documents Ability to account for retainage in project invoices, which include the draft invoices (pro forma) and Accounts Receivable invoices Construction package. The following functionality is available if the Construction feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form: Subcontract management Subcontract managementCompliance tracking Compliance trackingConstruction-specific reports Construction-specific reportsFor more information on particular features, see the respective chapter of this document. Project Task Types A project task can be of the following types that can be set either on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM302000|PM302000]) Project Tasks (PM302000) form or on the Tasks tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form: Cost Task - tasks of this type are visible on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form only. Revenue Task - tasks of this type are visible on the Revenue Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form only. Cost and Revenue Task - tasks of this type are visible both on the Revenue Budget and Cost Budget tabs of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form. Subcontract Management Subcontract is a document that represents a commitment with a vendor to provide goods and services for a project. Subcontract workflow is similar to the workflow of a purchase order that contains service lines and non-stock lines only. AP bills are entered directly for a subcontract once the work has been completed and the AP document has been received from the vendor. Subcontracts are entered on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form. Subcontract lines can be linked to projects by a complex key of project, project task, inventory ID, cost code in the same way as the lines of purchase orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. Subcontract entity is based on purchase order of Normal type and inherits its common functionality: Ability to enter prepayments for subcontracts. Ability to enter partial AP bills for subcontracts. Ability to complete or cancel subcontracts fully or line by line. Support for document workflow options: Ability to approve or reject subcontracts using the standard assignment and approval maps rules. Ability to email subcontracts. Ability to print subcontracts. Support for other options consistent with purchase order functionality: Tracking as project commitments. Change order functionality for project commitments. Compliance tracking. Tax calculation. Vendor prices. Subcontracts have the following specifics: Subcontracts do not utilize stock items and do not involve inventory management processes. Vendor-specific printed formats can be defined for subcontracts and purchase orders separately by the respective mailing IDs: Purchase Order: printed format of a purchase order entered on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders form. Subcontract: printed format of a subcontract entered on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts form. Subcontracts do not utilize the purchase to order process and cannot be linked to sales orders. Subcontracts do not utilize the blanket order workflow, which is available for purchase orders. Dedicated forms are provided for working with subcontracts: ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts data entry form ([~/?ScreenId=SC503000|SC503000]) Print/Email Subcontracts (SC503000) mass-processing form For more information on subcontract agreement forms and reports, see construction-specific reports. Compliance Tracking Firms managing construction projects have requirements to protect their clients, vendors, suppliers, and partners from the many potential issues associated with compliance. These compliance issues might be associated with federal, state and local governmental requirements, but may also be legal and procedural. Compliance tracking allows a firm to establish the compliance items that should be captured for different types of entities, so that this information can be used for in-place warnings to users and for reports on project exposure. The below types of compliance items are provided by default and can be extended with more types to track and report on: Certificate Insurance Lien Waiver Notice Other The user can configure common attributes that are available for all types of compliance, as well as define custom attributes for each compliance type in particular on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) '''Compliance Preferences''' (CL301000) form. Once a compliance type is configured, the compliance items of that type can be recorded and viewed on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL401000|CL401000]) Compliance Management (CL401000) form. Each compliance item can be associated with multiple entities such as project, project task, cost code, vendor, customer, and with various types of documents. On the Compliance tab of each of the forms listed below, the users can enter and review the compliance items associated with entity: ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM302000|PM302000]) Project Tasks (PM302000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM304000|PM304000]) Project Transactions (PM304000) ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM308000|PM308000]) Change Orders (PM308000) Based on the entered information, the system warns users of any records with compliance issues where applicable. For example, if a compliance item is overdue the system throws a warning message. Construction-Specific Reports The following inquiries, dashboards, and reports are now available: Commitments by Vendor Summary (CU000002) inquiry lists vendors with open commitments (Purchase Orders/Subcontracts) within the specified date range. Commitments are totaled together to provide an order quantity, open quantity, overall total, and the open balance across all commitments. Additionally, the list can be filtered for a single project, a single vendor, and/or inventory item. Use the hyperlink within the Vendor ID and Vendor Name columns to view the line item details by open commitment. Vendor Commitments Details (CU000001) inquiry lists open commitment line item details for the selected vendor, project, or inventory item (for example, labor, materials, subcontracts, and the like). Use the hyperlinks within the Account ID , Project , PO/Subcontract No , Inventory ID , or Cost Code columns, to obtain detailed information associated with the chosen column. For example, the hyperlink in the PO/Subcontract No. column will navigate to the Purchase Order or Subcontract form providing the user will access to available actions such as, printing or editing. Project Summary (CU000003) inquiry provides a high-level status of the contract, costs, and gross profit. Use the hyperlinks within the Project , Description , and Open Committed Costs columns to obtain detailed information associated with the chosen column. For example, clicking the link in the Open Committed Costs column will navigate to the Commitments inquiry providing a detailed list of commitments for the associated project. Project Dashboard (CU000013) dashboard. The Project Dashboard is customizable. The default configuration gives an overview of the costs by a project, contract status by a project, and gross profit by a project in a grid format. The columns of data shown in each grid can be displayed as separate widgets using a variety of chart types such as, doughnut. Project WIP (CU000004) report provides a way to track the progress and financial performance of project contracts while using that data to forecast future performance. Drilldown goes to Project WIP Detail report. Project WIP Detail (CU000005) report provides a way to track the progress and financial performance of project contracts while using that data to forecast future performance at a task and cost code level. Subcontract Short Form (CU000006) report is a snapshot of the contract details broken down by a task, cost code, and inventory item. The report should be customized to reflect the needs of the company. Subcontract Agreement Long Form (CU000011) report is a sample of a full contract outlining the details of the agreement. The report should be customized to reflect the needs of the company. Conditional Waiver on Progress Payment (CU000008) report provides a sample release of partial lien rights when the current payment has not been received and future payments are expected. Conditional Waiver on Final Payment (CU000007) report provides a sample release of the remaining lien rights when the current payment has not been received and no future payments are expected. Unconditional Waiver on Progress Payment (CU000010) report provides a sample release of partial lien rights when the current payment has been received and future payments are expected. Unconditional Waiver on Final Payment (CU000009) report provides a sample release of the remaining lien rights when the current payment has been received and no future payments are expected. Compliance by Vendor (CU000014) report lists compliance items matching the report parameters in three categories: Non-Project/Commitment Items, Project/Non-Commitment related items, and Project/Commitment related items. Compliance by Project (CU000012) report lists compliance items matching the report parameters in two categories for each project: Subcontractor(Vendor)/Non-Commitment related items and Subcontractor(Vendor)/Commitment related items. Project Profit Analysis (CU000015) report is a snapshot of the original profit compared to the revised profit. Project Performance (CU000016) report is a snapshot of the project performance to-date with both profit and markup values. Project Cost Budget Status (CU000017) report provides detail into the cost budget of a project showing budgeted, committed, and actual amounts resulting in the remaining budget values per project task and overall totals for the project. Drilldown in the project column navigates to the Projects form and drilldown into the task and description columns navigates to the Project Task form. Subcontract Audit (CU000018) report gives a snapshot of each subcontract showing the subcontract amount, changes, invoices, and outstanding balance. Subcontract (SC641000) report displays the subcontracts created in the Subcontracts module; you can print and email them. Subcontract Summary (SC610500) report shows summary information about subcontracts that are neither closed nor canceled. Subcontract Details by Vendor (SC611000) report displays detailed information about subcontracts that are neither closed nor canceled. The data in this report is grouped by vendor.

Work with a Subcontract: Implementation Activity The following activity will walk you through the process of configuring subcontract mailing. That is, you will learn how to create a notification template and specify mailing settings for a vendor class of subcontractors. Story Suppose that the SweetLife company hired the Standard Hardware Company subcontractor to perform some part of a job on building a hotel. The company is going to send a contract to the subcontractor by email. Acting as an administrator, you need to create a notification template for the subcontractor and configure a vendor class of the subcontractor to have this template in the mailing settings. Process Overview To configure subcontract mailing, you first create a template on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM204003|SM204003]) Notification Templates (SM204000) form. You then add this template to the mailing list of the subcontract vendor class on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP201000|AP201000]) Vendor Classes (AP201000) form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form, you can check the mailing settings of a particular vendor. System Preparation Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a sales manager by using the admin login and the 123 password. Step 1: Creating a Notification Template Do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM204003|SM204003]) Notification Templates (SM2040PL) form. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Screen Name box, select Subcontracts with the SC.30.10.00 screen ID. In the Description box, type Subcontracts . In the From box, select the System email account. This is the default account from which emails with subcontracts will be sent to vendors. In the Subject box, type Subcontract email . In the text editor area of the Message tab, specify the following text: Dear Vendor, Please find your subcontract attached. Sincerely yours, SweetLife On the form toolbar, click Save . Step 2: Adding Notification Template to a Subcontractor Class To add a notification template, do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=AP201000|AP201000]) Vendor Classes (AP201000) form. In the Class ID box, select SUBCON . On the Mailing Settings tab, do the following: In the Mailings table, make sure that the SUBCONTRACT mailing is listed and has the Active check box selected. For the SUBCONTRACT mailing, in the Email Account column, select the System email account. Make sure that SC.64.10.00 is specified in the Report column. This is the identifier of the Subcontract printed form that will be used for generating a short form of a subcontract to be attached to an email. In the Notification Template column, select the Subcontracts notification template. In the Recipients table, click Add Row , and in the Contact Type column, select the Remittance . Leave the default values for the remaining settings. On the form toolbar, click Save . Step 3: Reviewing Subcontractor Mailing Settings Do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form. In the Vendor box, select the HARDCO vendor. On the Mailing Settings tab, make sure that the settings of the SUBCONTRACT mailing have been copied from the SUBCON vendor class.

Work with a Subcontract: Process Activity The following activity will walk you through the process of working with a subcontract. Story Suppose that the SweetLife company hires a subcontractor, Standard Hardware Company, to install windows and doors in the hotel that is built by SweetLife. Initially, it is agreed that the Standard Hardware Company performs the following jobs: Installation of windows Installation of doors and frames Building an entrance A project manager of the SweetLife company creates a subcontract, prints the subcontract, and sends an email with the subcontract. After some consideration, SweetLife agrees with the subcontractor that the subcontractor will install only windows, and another subcontractor will install doors later. So SweetLife pays to the subcontractor only for installing windows. Acting as the project manager, you need to create a subcontract in the system, print and email it. Then you need to create and release a bill for installing windows and create and release a check for the bill. Finally, you complete the subcontract.Subcontracts Process Overview When you work with a subcontract, the first step that you perform is creating a subcontract on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form. After you created the subcontract, you print it (if necessary) and send by email to the subcontractor (if necessary). When the subcontractor finished the job or a part of the job of the subcontract and sent your company an invoice, you create a bill to pay for this job on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. After you paid, you create a check for the bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) form. When all jobs are paid, you complete the subcontract on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts form. System Preparation Before you start working with subcontracts, do the following: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in as a sales manager by using the brawner login and the 123 password. Make sure that the mailing settings for subcontractors have been configured, as described in Work with a Subcontract: Implementation Activity. Step 1: Creating a Subcontract To create a subcontract, do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Vendor box, select HARDCO - Standard Hardware Company . In the Description box, type Installing of windows and doors . On the Document Details tab, add lines with the settings specified in the table below. Inventory ID Project Cost Task Cost Code Line Description Ext. Cost SUBCON HOTEL 08 08-510 Windows 650,000.00 SUBCON HOTEL 08 08-200 Doors and frames 442,000.00 SUBCON HOTEL 08 08-800 Entrance 2,000,000.00 In the Summary area, in the Subcontract Total box, make sure that the total is 3,092,000.00 . On the Other Information tab, clear the Don't Print and Don't Email check boxes. If these check boxes are selected, the subcontract will get the Open status when it is taken off hold. If these check boxes are cleared, the subcontract will get the Pending Printing status first. Clear the Hold check box. The system changes the subcontract status to Pending Printing . On the form toolbar, click Save . Step 2: Printing the Subcontract and Sending an Email with It Do the following: While you are still on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form, click Reports Print Subcontract on the form toolbar. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=SC641000|SC641000]) Subcontract (SC641000) report. For the learning purposes of this activity, you do not need to actually print the subcontract. In Click Print on the form toolbar to print the short form of the subcontract. Return back to the subcontract on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts form. On the form toolbar, click Actions Email Subcontract . The system creates an email activity associated with the subcontract. As a result, the Activities counter on the title bar of the form increases by one. Click that counter. Click Activities (1) on the title bar. In the Tasks and Activities dialog box, which opens, click the Subcontract email link to review the generated email. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR306015|CR306015]) Email Activity (CR306015) form, which opens, review the From and To email addresses, the message of the email, and the summary information of the subcontract. Click Files on the title bar. In the Files dialog box, which opens, in the File Name column, click the link to the attached PDF file. Review the short form of the subcontract that has been attached to the email generated for the vendor. row.PlainText: Processing Joint Payments In this chapter, you will find an activity that will help you learn about processing of joint payments in the system.

row.column: Joint Payments: Process Activity A joint check is a check generated for an accounts payable bill that includes joint payees. This check is used for making a payment jointly to two or more parties. A joint check is used as a guarantee that the funds associated with the material or work provided to a contractor (subcontractor or general contractor) on a project are paid to a vendor that is not an active member of the project team. In this lesson, you will learn how to do the following: Specify joint payees for an accounts payable bill Specify joint amounts for different lines of an accounts payable bill Create joint checks and process the payments Story Suppose that a storm broke windows in the hotel that the SweetLife company is building. The company needs to replace the broken windows and clean the area. The Acme Doors & Glass vendor will do the job for the SweetLife company. Also, they subcontracted the OfficeUp Original and Conwaste company to dispose of any waste and clean the area. At the end, SweetLife needs to issue and print a joint check that reflects the joint payment amounts. Process Overview To make a joint payment, you first create an AP bill that includes joint payees on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. And then create and process a check for this bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) form. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this lesson, the following features have been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form: Construction (under the Projects group of features) Payment Application by Line On the Payment Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form, the Pay by Line check box is selected for the DOORSCO vendor. System Preparation Sign in as a project manager by using the owen login and the 123 password. Step 1: Processing a Joint Bill Do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Vendor box, select DOORSCO - Acme Doors & Glass . Select the Joint Payees check box. In the Description box, type Replacing broken windows after the storm . On the Document Details tab, add lines with the settings specified in the table below. Inventory ID Quantity Unit Cost Project Cost Task Cost Code WINDISMNTL 8 500.00 HOTEL 02 02-000 WINDISPOSE 4 200.00 HOTEL 02 02-000 WINCLEAN 4 100.00 HOTEL 02 02-000 On the Joint Payees tab, add lines with the settings specified in the table below. Joint Payee (Vendor) Joint Payee Bill Line Nbr. Joint Amount Owed Conwaste 2 400.00 OFFICEUP 3 200.00 In the Bill Line Nbr. column, you specify the number of the bill line that corresponds to the item for which the joint payee is to receive the payment. The Balance of the line, which you can review on the Document Details tab, will be reduced by the amount specified in the Joint Amount Paid column when the payment is released. If the Pay by Line check box on the Financial Details tab is cleared for the bill, the Joint Amount Paid affects the balance of the entire bill. On the Joint Payees tab, you can specify a joint payee in any of the following ways: If the joint payee is registered in your system as a vendor, you can select that vendor in the Joint Payee (Vendor) column. If there is no vendor record that corresponds to the joint payee, you can simply type the name in the text box in the Joint Payee column. Note that the sum of the joint amounts must not be greater than or equal to the total amount of the bill. At first, the joint balance for each line equals the joint amount owed. Partial payments may be applied to the lines, and as a result, the joint balance would decrease until it is completely paid and thus reduced to zero. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area of the form. Click Release on the form toolbar. Step 2: Processing a Joint Payment Do the following: While you are still on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form, on the form toolbar, click Actions Pay Bill/Apply Payment . The Indicate Amounts to Pay dialog box opens. In the dialog box, do the following: In the Amount to Pay box, enter 400. This amount defines the part of the payment that the Acme Doors & Glass vendor is going to receive. This amount cannot be greater than the amount displayed in the Max Available Amount box. In the Joint Amount to Pay column of the table below, enter 200 for the Conwaste joint payee and 100 for the OFFICEUP joint payee. Click Confirm . As a result, three joint checks are created: A check for 400 USD, which is the vendor payment amount A check for 200 USD, which is the joint payment amount for the Conwaste joint payee And a check for 100 USD, which is the joint payment amount for the OFFICEUP joint payee On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) form, open each check and clear the Hold check box. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP505000|AP505000]) Process Payments / Print Checks (AP505000) form, select the unlabeled check box for each of the joint checks and click Process on the form toolbar to print the checks. The form that is used to print check is opened. For learning purposes, you do not need to print the checks so you can close the form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP505200|AP505200]) Release Payments (AP505200) form, which opens, you can release the payments by clicking Process on the form toolbar. Note that the unlabeled check boxes are selected automatically for the corresponding payments.

row.PlainText: Processing Lien Waivers In this chapter, you will find an activity that will help you learn about processing of lien waiver in the system.

row.column:
A lien waiver is a compliance document involved in the payment process for a project. The party that receives a payment (for instance, a contractor, subcontractor, or material supplier) signs a lien waiver to waive their rights against the property in exchange for the payment. ==Learning Objectives== In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following:[anchor|#_a76539ea-c56f-4d34-85e0-de3be3918691] *Configure automatic generation of lien waivers *Set up warnings on outstanding lien waivers *Configure the mailing of lien waivers *Process lien waivers
==Lien Waiver Types== Basic types of lien waivers:[anchor|#_76f56437-0c8a-44cf-8813-217c586d3c77] *''Conditional'' waivers for ''partial'' (or progress) payment: Used when a progress payment on the project is expected. A signed lien waiver of this type becomes effective immediately after the payment has been received. *''Conditional'' waivers for ''final'' payment: Used when the entire contract value is to be paid at one time or when the payment in question is the final payment for a project. A signed lien waiver of this type also becomes effective only after the payment has been received. *''Unconditional'' waivers for ''partial'' (or progress payment): Used when a progress payment on the project is expected. A lien waiver of this type becomes effective after it has been signed, regardless of whether the payment has been actually received. *''Unconditional'' waivers for ''final'' payment: Used for a one-time payment or for the final payment for a project. A lien waiver of this type becomes unconditionally effective once it has been signed even if no payment has been actually received.
Users can manually create new lien waivers, or automatic generation of lien waivers can be set up in the system, separately for conditional and unconditional lien waivers.

Lien Waivers: General Information A lien waiver is a compliance document involved in the payment process for a project. The party that receives a payment (for instance, a contractor, subcontractor, or material supplier) signs a lien waiver to waive their rights against the property in exchange for the payment. Learning Objectives In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following: Configure automatic generation of lien waivers Set up warnings on outstanding lien waivers Configure the mailing of lien waivers Process lien waivers Lien Waiver Types Basic types of lien waivers: Conditional waivers for partial (or progress) payment: Used when a progress payment on the project is expected. A signed lien waiver of this type becomes effective immediately after the payment has been received. Conditional waivers for final payment: Used when the entire contract value is to be paid at one time or when the payment in question is the final payment for a project. A signed lien waiver of this type also becomes effective only after the payment has been received. Unconditional waivers for partial (or progress payment): Used when a progress payment on the project is expected. A lien waiver of this type becomes effective after it has been signed, regardless of whether the payment has been actually received. Unconditional waivers for final payment: Used for a one-time payment or for the final payment for a project. A lien waiver of this type becomes unconditionally effective once it has been signed even if no payment has been actually received. Users can manually create new lien waivers, or automatic generation of lien waivers can be set up in the system, separately for conditional and unconditional lien waivers.

Lien Waivers: Implementation Activity The following activity will walk you through the process of configuring generation of lien waivers. Story Suppose that the SweetLife company wants conditional lien waivers to be automatically generated when payments linked to AP bills are submitted. You need to configure mailing of lien waivers and their automatic generation. Process Overview Brief description of workflow (with forms, on which particular actions are performed). System Preparation Sign in as a project manager by using the owen login and the 123 password. Step 1: Configuring the Mailing of Lien Waivers The processing of lien waivers includes emailing the documents to vendors who should return them signed. So that the system can generate emails with lien waivers attached, mailing should be properly configured. To configure the mailing, do the following: Create a notification template for lien waivers as follows: On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM204003|SM204003]) Notification Templates (SM2040PL) form, click Add New Record on the form toolbar. In the Screen Name box, select the Print/Email Lien Waivers (CL502000) form. In the Description box, type Lien Waivers . In the Subject box, type Lien waiver email . In the text editor area on the Message tab, specify the following text: Dear Vendor, Here's your lien waiver. Sincerely yours, SweetLife Save the changes. When generating emails with lien waivers, the system will use the subject and the message body from the notification template. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP201000|AP201000]) Vendor Classes (AP201000) form, select the SUBCON vendor class, click the Mailing Settings tab, and do the following: Make sure that the Conditional Final and Conditional Partial mailings are included in the Mailings table and marked as Active . For each of these mailings, select the Lien Waiver notification template in the Notification Template column and in the Recipients table below, add a row with Remittance selected in the Contact Type column and default settings specified in other columns. Make sure that in the Report column, CL642003 is specified for the Conditional Final mailing and CL642001 for the Conditional Partial mailing. These are the identifiers of the printed forms that will be generated and attached to an email. Save the changes. These settings will be copied for any new vendor of the class. Note that mailing settings may be overridden and set up as needed for any individual vendor. When generating emails with lien waivers, the system will specify the email address of the remittance contact of the vendor (which you can review on the Payment Settings tab of the Vendors form) as the recipient address. Emails will be sent from the default system email account. Step 2: Configuring Automatic Generation of Lien Waivers Do the following: On the Lien Waiver Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) Compliance Preferences Compliance Preferences (CL301000) form, do the following: Select the Automatically Generate Lien Waivers check box in the Conditional Lien Waivers group of elements. Review the default settings and click Save on the form toolbar. Because the Hold Documents on Entry check box is selected on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP101000|AP101000]) Accounts Payable Preferences (AP101000) form, a lien waiver will be generated when the status of the accounts payable check (or checks) changes from On Hold to Pending Printing or Balanced . (If the Hold Documents on Entry check box is cleared, a lien waiver is generated immediately when the accounts payable check is created with the Pending Printing or Balanced status.) The through date is set to be the last day of the posting period of the accounts payable bill. This date defines by which date the party that signs a lien waiver agrees to waive their rights for the work completed since the previous lien waiver (if any). The amount of an automatically generated final conditional lien waiver will equal the amount of the accounts payable bill. On the Lien Waiver Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects Projects (PM301000) form, for the HOTEL project, review the Through Date setting and then, in the table below it, specify the following settings: Vendor Class : SUBCON (this indicates that conditional lien waivers may be automatically generated only for vendors that belong to this vendor class) Minimum Commitment Amount : 2000 (lien waivers will be automatically generated for commitments whose amount is larger than or equal to the specified minimum amount) Save the changes. On the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP201000|AP201000]) Vendor Classes (AP201000) form, for the SUBCON vendor class, select the Generate Lien Waivers Automatically check box to indicate that lien waivers will be automatically generated for vendors that belong to this vendor class. The lien waiver settings specified for the particular project will be used for generating the lien waivers. On the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors Vendors (AP303000) form, create a vendor with the following settings specified: Vendor ID : ARCHCO Vendor Name : Architectural Design Company Email : main@abc.con Vendor Class : SUBCON Make sure that the Generate Lien Waivers Based on Project Settings check box is selected. Save the changes.

The following activity will walk you through the process of working with lien waivers. ==Story== Suppose that the SweetLife company pays bills to a subcontractor. You need to create and pay these bills in the system and make sure that the related lien waivers have been generated. ==System Preparation== Sign in as a project manager by using the ''owen'' login and the ''123'' password. ==Step 1: '''Working with Lien Waivers'''== Do the following:[anchor|#_ec2df785-4d5c-4386-bbba-5ffd04ffedaf] #On the [HelpRoot_Construction\SC_30_10_00|Subcontracts] ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) form, create a subcontract for the ''ARCHCO'' vendor with the following document line specified on the '''Document Details''' tab: #*'''Inventory ID''': ''MATERIAL'' #* '''Project''': ''HOTEL'' #* '''Project Task''': ''02 - SITEWORK'' #* '''Cost Code''': 02-000 #*'''Order Qty.''': 100 #*'''Unit Cost''': 500 #*:The total amount of this commitment is ''50000'', which exceeds the minimum commitment amount specified for the vendor and project. #Save the changes. #:(Now you can review the new commitment record on the '''Commitments''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form for the ''HOTEL'' project.) #Take the subcontract off hold–that is, clear the '''Hold''' check box. #On the form toolbar, click '''Actions''' > '''Enter AP Bill'''. #:The [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) form opens, with ''Bill'' selected in the '''Type''' box by default and with document details copied from the subcontract. #Take the bill off hold–that is, clear the '''Hold''' check box. #Click '''Release''' on the form toolbar to release the bill. #On the form toolbar, click '''Actions''' > '''Pay Bill/Apply Adjustment'''. #:The [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_20_00|Checks and Payments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) form opens, with details copied from the bill. #Review the status of the document–the check should be on hold. Review the '''Compliance''' tab–it should be empty at this point. #While on the '''Compliance''' tab, clear the '''Hold''' check box in the Summary area and then save the changes. #:Note that a lien waiver record appears in the table on the '''Compliance''' tab. #:Note that the same lien waiver record appears on the '''Compliance''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]), [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_30_00|Vendors] ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]), [HelpRoot_Construction\SC_30_10_00|Subcontracts] ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]), and [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) forms for the involved documents. #:Also, the record appears on the [HelpRoot_Construction\CL_40_10_00|Compliance Management] ([~/?ScreenId=CL401000|CL401000]) form. #On the ''Print/Email Lien Waivers'' (CL502000) form, do the following: ##In the '''Action''' box, select ''Email Lien Waivers''. ##Select the unlabeled check box for the lien waiver that you want to email to the vendor. ##Click '''Process''' on the form toolbar. #:If an email has been successfully created, the lien waiver is marked as processed (that is, the Processed check box becomes selected in the lien waiver details). #Review the list of outgoing emails on the '''All Records''' tab of the Outgoing (CO409020) form–the newly created email should be at the top of the list. #:Click the link in the '''Subject''' column and review the email on the Email Activity form that opens. Lien Waivers: Process Activity The following activity will walk you through the process of working with lien waivers. Story Suppose that the SweetLife company pays bills to a subcontractor. You need to create and pay these bills in the system and make sure that the related lien waivers have been generated. System Preparation Sign in as a project manager by using the owen login and the 123 password. Step 1: Working with Lien Waivers Do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form, create a subcontract for the ARCHCO vendor with the following document line specified on the Document Details tab: Inventory ID : MATERIAL Project : HOTEL Project Task : 02 - SITEWORK Cost Code : 02-000 Order Qty. : 100 Unit Cost : 500 The total amount of this commitment is 50000 , which exceeds the minimum commitment amount specified for the vendor and project. Save the changes. (Now you can review the new commitment record on the Commitments tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects Projects (PM301000) form for the HOTEL project.) Take the subcontract off hold–that is, clear the Hold check box. On the form toolbar, click Actions Enter AP Bill . The ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form opens, with Bill selected in the Type box by default and with document details copied from the subcontract. Take the bill off hold–that is, clear the Hold check box. Click Release on the form toolbar to release the bill. On the form toolbar, click Actions Pay Bill/Apply Adjustment . The ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments(AP302000) form opens, with details copied from the bill. Review the status of the document–the check should be on hold. Review the Compliance tab–it should be empty at this point. While on the Compliance tab, clear the Hold check box in the Summary area and then save the changes. Note that a lien waiver record appears in the table on the Compliance tab. Note that the same lien waiver record appears on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects Projects (PM301000), ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors Vendors (AP303000), ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000), and ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) forms for the involved documents. Also, the record appears on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL401000|CL401000]) Compliance Management (CL401000) form. On the Print/Email Lien Waivers (CL502000) form, do the following: In the Action box, select Email Lien Waivers . Select the unlabeled check box for the lien waiver that you want to email to the vendor. Click Process on the form toolbar. If an email has been successfully created, the lien waiver is marked as processed (that is, the Processed check box becomes selected in the lien waiver details). Review the list of outgoing emails on the All Records tab of the Outgoing (CO409020) form–the newly created email should be at the top of the list. Click the link in the Subject column and review the email on the Email Activity form that opens. Click Files on the title bar to review the printed form of the lien waiver attached to the email. On the Lien Waivers tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CL401000|CL401000]) Compliance Management form, review the details of the processed lien waiver. When you receive a signed copy of the lien waiver, you need to manually mark it as received by selecting the Received from Vendor check box. (Note that the check box should remain cleared for the next exercise.) Step 2: Working with Outstanding Lien Waivers An outstanding lien waiver is a lien waiver that has not been marked as received and whose Through Date is earlier than the current business date in the system. Do the following: On the Lien Waiver Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) Compliance Preferences Compliance Preferences (CL301000) form, select the following check boxes and save the changes: Warn of Outstanding Lien Waivers During AP Bill Entry : A warning will appear if the system finds an outstanding lien waiver when the user attempts to enter an accounts payable bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. Warn of Outstanding Lien Waivers when Selecting AP Bill for Payment : A warning will appear if the system finds an outstanding lien waiver when the user attempts to select an accounts payable bill for a payment on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) form. Note that these warnings may also appear on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP503000|AP503000]) Prepare Payments Prepare Payments (AP503000) form during the processing. Stop Payment of AP Bill When There Are Outstanding Lien Waivers : The system will show an error message and stop the payment in the following circumstances: On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments Bills and Adjustments form, when a user clicks Actions > Pay Bill/Apply Adjustment on the form toolbar for an accounts payable bill that has a linked outstanding lien waiver. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments form, when a user attempts to take off hold or release a check that has a linked outstanding lien waiver. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP503000|AP503000]) Prepare Payments Prepare Payments, ([~/?ScreenId=AP505000|AP505000]) Process Payments / Print Checks Process Payments / Print Checks (AP505000), or ([~/?ScreenId=AP505200|AP505200]) Release Payments Release Payments (AP505200) form, when the user initiates the processing of the document. Change the business date to the last day of the next month. Thus, the lien waiver that was generated in the previous exercise will be considered as an outstanding lien waiver because it hasn't been marked as received and its Through Date is earlier than the current business date. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments Bills and Adjustments form, do the following: Start entering a new bill for the ARCHCO vendor. When you start entering a document detail line and specify a related project, a warning appears next to the Vendor box in the Summary area of the form. This warning appears because the Warn of Outstanding Lien Waivers During AP Bill Entry check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) Compliance Preferences Compliance Preferences form. Enter all necessary settings and save the changes to create the bill anyway. Clear the Hold check box in the Summary area and click Release on the form toolbar. Click Actions > Pay Bill/Apply Adjustment . An error message is displayed notifying you that no payment can be created for the bill because it is linked to at least one outstanding lien waiver. This message appears because the Stop Payment of AP Bill When There Are Outstanding Lien Waivers check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) Compliance Preferences Compliance Preferences form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) form, create a new check for the ARCHCO vendor, and on the Documents to Apply tab, select the bill created in the previous step and specify a line number in respective columns. Immediately after that, the system displays a warning that the vendor has at least one outstanding lien waiver. This warning appears because the Warn of Outstanding Lien Waivers when Selecting AP Bill for Payment check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) Compliance Preferences Compliance Preferences form. Now, before you continue your work with this vendor, you may want to remind them that you need to receive the signed lien waiver first (and manually mark the corresponding lien waiver as received). Change the business date back to the current date.

row.column: Compliance Tab The Compliance tab is added to multiple Acumatica ERP forms to support functionality of the applied Construction package. This topic lists altered Acumatica ERP forms and provides reference information for the Compliance tab functionality. Finance Accounts Payable: ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) ([~/?ScreenId=AP302000|AP302000]) Checks and Payments (AP302000) Accounts Receivable: ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR302000) ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) Organization Projects: ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM302000|PM302000]) Project Tasks (PM302000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM304000|PM304000]) Project Transactions (PM304000) Distribution Purchase Orders: ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) Subcontracts: ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) Table The Compliance tab contains the table that lists compliance documents created by the user. The table contains only those compliance documents, which are associated with the entity that is created on the form. You can add and update compliance documents within this tab. The table toolbar includes only standard buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar. Table Columns Column Description Document Type The type of the compliance document. The following document types are available: Certificate Insurance Notice Lien Waiver Other Creation Date The date when the compliance document was created. By default, the current date is set. The user is able to change the date manually. Document Type Option The document type option of the compliance’s document type. The list of document type options should be set manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) '''Compliance Preferences''' (CL301000) form. Status The status of the compliance document. The list of values should be set manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=CL301000|CL301000]) '''Compliance Preferences''' form. Is Required A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is mandatory for working with a specific project or project task. This flag is for informational purposes only. It shows that the compliance document is required before implementing some activities on a project. Received A check box that indicates (if selected) that the document is received by user. The Received check box allows the user to track when the payment for document is received, so the next payment is not delayed. Received Date The date when the compliance document is received. The date should be set manually by the user on the Compliance tab after the document is received. Sent Date The date when the compliance document is sent. The date should be set manually by the user on the Compliance tab after the document is sent. Effective Date The date when the compliance document takes effect. The date should be set manually by the user while adding the document on the Compliance tab. Expiration Date The date when the compliance document will expire. The date should be set manually by the user while adding the document on the Compliance tab. Limit The amount of insurance liability set for the compliance document. The amount should be set manually by the user while adding the document on the Compliance tab. Method Sent The method of sending the document. Project The reference to a project to which a compliance document relates. By default, it is set to the identifier of the project selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form of the selected project. Cost Task The reference to a cost task available within the project. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM302000|PM302000]) Project Tasks (PM302000) form of the selected task of the Cost Task type. Revenue Task The reference to a revenue task within the project. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM302000|PM302000]) Project Tasks form of the selected task of the Revenue Task type. Cost Code The cost code assigned to the compliance document. Customer The reference number of the customer associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the customer selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form of the selected customer. Customer Name The name of the customer associated with the compliance document. Vendor The reference number of the vendor associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the vendor selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form of the selected vendor. Vendor Name The name of the vendor associated with the compliance document. Secondary Vendor The reference number of the secondary vendor associated with the compliance document. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form of the selected vendor. Secondary Vendor Name The name of the secondary vendor associated with the compliance document. Purchase Order The unique identifier of the purchase order associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the purchase order selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form of the selected purchase order. Purchase Order Line Item The unique identifier of the purchase order line item. It can be specified only after a purchase order is selected. Subcontract The unique identifier of the subcontract associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the subcontract selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000]) Subcontracts (SC301000) form of the selected subcontract. Subcontract Line Item The unique identifier of the subcontract line. It can be specified only after a subcontract is selected. Invoice The reference number of the invoice associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the invoice selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AR301000|AR301000]) Invoices and Memos (AR301000) form of the selected invoice. Invoice Amount The amount of the invoice. Bill The reference number of the bill associated with the compliance document. By default, it is set to the identifier of the bill selected in the Summary area of the form. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form of the selected bill. Bill Amount The bill amount to be paid for the document. Lien Waiver Amount The amount covered by the lien waiver. Sponsor Organization The name of the sponsor organization. Certificate Number The number of the certificate. Insurance Company The name of the insurance company. Policy The insurance policy number. Account The account associated with the vendor (Expense account) or customer (Sales account). AP Check The reference number of the check associated with the compliance document. AR Payment The reference number of the payment associated with the compliance document. Project Transaction The reference number of the project transaction associated with the compliance document. Payment Date The date when the check is created. Receipt Date The date when the inventory receipt is made. Date Issued The date when the document is issued. Through Date The date when the goods are shipped. Receive Date The date when the goods are received. Received By The person responsible for receiving goods. Source The source of the check. One of the following values is allowed: AP Inv PO/Sub Project Customer Requires Joint Check A check box that indicates (if selected) that the joint check is required. Joint Vendor The reference number of the joint vendor associated with the compliance document. If specified, current document will be displayed on the Compliance tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form of the selected vendor. Joint Amount The amount to be paid to joint payees according to the joint check. Joint Release A check box that indicates (if selected) that the joint release is received. AP Payment Method The payment method associated with the vendor. AR Payment Method The customer’s default payment method.

The form-specific buttons are listed below.[anchor|#_770fc7f2-7392-46c2-ab6f-8b0111afe5c3] {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="20%" ! Button !width="80%" ! Description |- | '''Approve''' | Provides the following menu commands, which you can click to invoke actions:[anchor|#_8194715d-09f9-4c5b-b431-a663971e52af] *'''Approve''': Approves the current subcontract. *:This action is available if the ''Approval Workflow'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form. *'''Reject''': Rejects the current subcontract. This action opens the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) form with a new accounts payable bill that has all the details copied from the subcontract. *'''Complete Subcontract''': Completes the current subcontract, which changes its status to ''Closed''. *'''Cancel Subcontract''': Cancels the subcontract, which changes its status to ''Canceled''. A subcontract with this status cannot be edited. You can later manually change its status to ''On Hold'' (by selecting the '''Hold''' check box) and edit the subcontract. *'''Validate Addresses''': Validates the account addresses through integration with a specialized third-party software or service. *:This action appears only if the ''Address Validation'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] form. *'''Recalculate Prices''': Opens the [[#_6e0cb5d7-179c-4c12-997d-6341da69c689|Recalculate Prices] dialog box, which you can use to specify the extent to which you want to refresh the prices and discounts for the document. *'''Create Prepayment''': Creates a prepayment linked to this subcontract. The system opens the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) form with a new prepayment request (based on the subcontract) that is ready to be saved. Subcontracts Form ID: (SC301000) ([~/?ScreenId=SC301000|SC301000])On this form, you can view existing subcontracts, create new subcontracts, and add lines to subcontracts. Once a subcontract has been saved, it can be approved, rejected, or canceled by any employee assigned to review this subcontract. Form Toolbar The form toolbar includes standard and form-specific buttons. For the list of standard buttons, see Form Toolbar. The form-specific buttons are listed below. Button Description Approve Provides the following menu commands, which you can click to invoke actions: Approve : Approves the current subcontract. This action is available if the Approval Workflow feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Reject : Rejects the current subcontract. After a subcontract has been rejected, you can change its status to On Hold , correct the subcontract, take it off hold, and save your changes, which subjects the subcontract to approval again. This action is available if the Approval Workflow feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Email Subcontract : Emails (based on the settings of the SUBCONTRACT mailing) the subcontract to the vendor specified in this subcontract. For more information, see Mailings for Customers. Mark as Do Not Email : Causes the Don’t Email check box (on the Other Information tab) to be selected for the subcontract, to skip the step of emailing the subcontract. Enter AP Bill : Creates an accounts payable bill based on the current subcontract. This action opens the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form with a new accounts payable bill that has all the details copied from the subcontract. Complete Subcontract : Completes the current subcontract, which changes its status to Closed . Cancel Subcontract : Cancels the subcontract, which changes its status to Canceled . A subcontract with this status cannot be edited. You can later manually change its status to On Hold (by selecting the Hold check box) and edit the subcontract. Validate Addresses : Validates the account addresses through integration with a specialized third-party software or service. This action appears only if the Address Validation feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Recalculate Prices : Opens the Recalculate Prices Recalculate Prices dialog box, which you can use to specify the extent to which you want to refresh the prices and discounts for the document. Create Prepayment : Creates a prepayment linked to this subcontract. The system opens the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form with a new prepayment request (based on the subcontract) that is ready to be saved. The prepayment can be used to pay for this subcontract directly when the goods are received. Inquiries Provides the following menu command, which you can click for quick access to the inquiry form: Vendor Details : Opens the ([~/?ScreenId=AP402000|AP402000]) Vendor Details (AP402000) form, which displays the data related to the vendor from which the goods in this subcontract are ordered. Reports Provides the following menu command, which you can click for quick navigation to the report: Print Subcontract : To print the current subcontract by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SC641000|SC641000]) Subcontract (SC641000) report. Recalculate Prices Dialog Box You use this dialog box to specify the options to be used for updating the prices (referred to in subcontract as unit costs) and discounts for the subcontract. Element Description Recalculate The way prices and discounts are recalculated. You can select one of the following options: Current Line : To recalculate prices and discounts for the selected line All Lines : To recalculate prices and discounts for all lines Set Current Unit Prices A check box that indicates (if selected) that the system must replace the item prices with the current prices in the selected line or all lines. Override Manual Prices A check box that indicates (if selected) that the system must replace the item prices that have been modified manually (in the Unit Cost or Ext. Cost column) with the current prices. The check box is available for selection if the Set Current Unit Prices check box is selected. Recalculate Discounts A check box that indicates (if selected) that the system must recalculate the discounts for the selected line or all lines. This check box is available only if the Customer and Vendor Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. Override Manual Line Discounts A check box that indicates (if selected) that the system should cancel the manual discounts for the selected line or all lines (depending on the option selected in the Recalculate box) and search for applicable automatic discounts. This check box is available only if the Customer and Vendor Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. This dialog box has the following button. OK Closes the dialog box and applies the selected options to the subcontract. Document Summary Area In this area, you can enter summary information for a new subcontract. You can also find an existing subcontract by its subcontract number and view (and edit, if needed) its details. Element Description Subcontract Nbr. The unique reference number of the subcontract, which the system assigns based on the numbering sequence assigned to subcontracts, as specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences (SC101000) form. Hold A check box that you select to give the subcontract the On Hold status. You can clear the check box to change the status of the subcontract to Open . Status The system-generated status of the subcontract, which is one of the following options: On Hold : The subcontract is a draft and can be edited manually. Open : The subcontract has been processed in accordance with the settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences form but has not been completed yet. Pending Approval : The subcontract has not been approved by all the assigned persons, and this approval is required. The subcontract’s assignment for approval is performed according to the approval map selected for subcontracts on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences form. This status is available only if the Approval Workflow feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form and an approval map has been specified in the Approval Map box of the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences form. Rejected : The subcontract was rejected by one of the persons assigned to approve it. This status is available only if the Approval Workflow feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form and an approval map has been specified in the Approval Map box of the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences form. Pending Printing : Printing is required for the document but has not been performed yet. The subcontract should be printed if the Print Orders check box (on the Purchase Settings tab) is selected for the vendor on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form. Pending Email : Emailing is required for this document, but it has not been performed yet. The subcontract should be emailed if the Send Orders by Email check box (on the Purchase Settings tab) is selected for the vendor on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors form. Closed : All the ordered services have been received. Canceled : The subcontract was canceled through the Cancel Subcontract action (on the Actions menu of the form toolbar). A subcontract with this status cannot be edited. Approved A check box that indicates (if selected) that the subcontract has been approved. This element is available only if the Approval Workflow feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Date The date when the subcontract was created. All transactions included in this document will have this date. Start Date The date when the vendor has promised that the items listed in the subcontract will be received at their destination location. Description A brief description of the subcontract. Vendor The vendor from which the items will be purchased, by its ID. Owner The user name of the employee who is responsible for the subcontract. Currency The currency the subcontract will be paid in. Vendor Ref. The reference number of the vendor document related to this subcontract. This element is required if the Require Vendor Reference check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP101000|AP101000]) Accounts Payable Preferences (AP101000) form. Line Total The total sum of the Extended Amount entries for all lines in the current subcontract. This value is calculated by the system, and you cannot manually change it. Discount Total The discount total calculated for the document. This total includes discounts of the Group and Document levels. The discounts of the Group and Document levels are listed on the Discount Details tab; the Line discounts are shown on the Document Details tab. This box is available only if the Customer & Vendor Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. VAT Exempt Total The document total that is exempt from VAT. This total is calculated as the taxable amount for the tax with the Include in VAT Exempt Total check box selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205000|TX205000]) Taxes (TX205000) form. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. VAT Taxable Total The document total that is subject to VAT. The VAT taxable amount is displayed in this box only if the Include in VAT Taxable Total check box is selected for the applicable tax on the ([~/?ScreenId=TX205000|TX205000]) Taxes (TX205000) form. If the check box is cleared, this box is empty. If the document contains multiple transactions with different taxes applied and each of the applied taxes has this check box selected, the taxable amount calculated for each line of the document is added to the VAT Taxable Total box of the document. This box is available only if the VAT Reporting feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Tax Total The total tax amount for all lines added to the current subcontract. This value, also calculated by the system, is the sum of the tax amounts for each line. Subcontract Total The total sum for the subcontract, including taxes. This read-only value is the sum of the Line Total and Tax Total values. Control Total The subcontract’s total amount (including taxes), which you must enter manually when you attempt to save the subcontract with the Open status. This value must be the same as the Subcontract Total value, which the system has calculated automatically. This box appears only if the Validate Total on Entry check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=SC101000|SC101000]) Subcontracts Preferences form. Document Details Tab The Document Details tab has a table with detailed information about the non-stock items to be purchased according to the subcontract. The table toolbar includes standard buttons and buttons specific to this table. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar. The table-specific buttons are listed below. Shortcut Menu If you right-click within the rows of a table, the system opens a shortcut menu. Most of the commands you see in the menu are duplicates of actions on the table toolbar. The unique menu commands are listed below. Button Description Insert Row Inserts a blank row above the row that is currently selected in the table. Cut Row Copies the selected row or rows to the clipboard. Insert Cut Row Inserts the row or rows that have been copied to the clipboard above the currently selected row or rows. Table Columns Column Description Branch The branch to receive the item. Inventory ID The identifier of the stock or non-stock item, which has been configured on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) or ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form , respectively . You can select any inventory item if the Allow Adding New Items to Subcontracts On the Fly check box is selected in the settings of the related project on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form; if the check box is cleared, you can select only inventory items that are presented in the cost budget of the related project. You can also enter the alternate ID in this box; if you do, the system will search for the corresponding non-stock item and replace the alternate ID you entered with the corresponding ID. Project The project with which this subcontract line is associated. Project Task The project task with which this subcontract is associated. Cost Code The cost code with which this subcontract is associated. Line Description A description of the subcontract line, which is copied from the item’s description. UOM The unit of measure (UOM) in which the quantity of the item is specified. If the value in the Qty. on Receipts column is greater than zero, you cannot change the UOM for this line. Order Qty. The quantity of the item that has been ordered, expressed in the unit of measure specified in the UOM column. Unit Cost The cost per UOM of the non-stock item. If you enter the unit cost (vendor price) manually and save the document, this value will not be updated by the system when you change the document date. If you want to replace this value with the vendor price currently available for the item, use the Recalculate Prices action. Ext. Cost The extended cost of the non-stock item, which is the unit cost multiplied by the quantity. If you enter the extended cost manually and save the document, the value will not be updated by the system when you change the document date. If you want the extended cost to be recalculated automatically based on the applicable vendor price, use the Recalculate Prices action. Discount Percent If the Vendor and Customer Discounts feature is not enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, the percent of the discount that has been entered manually or calculated based on the discount amount entered manually for this line item. If the Vendor and Customer Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form, the percent of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically. If the Manual Discount check box is selected, you can enter the percent manually and the discount amount will be calculated automatically. Discount Amount If the Vendor and Customer Discounts feature is not enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form, the amount of the discount that has been specified manually or calculated based on the discount percent entered manually. If the Vendor and Customer Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form, the amount of the line-level discount that has been applied manually or automatically to this line. If the Manual Discount check box is selected, you can enter the discount amount manually and the discount percent will be calculated automatically. Manual Discount A check box that indicates (if selected) that the discount has been applied manually. With this check box selected, you can enter either the discount percent or the discount amount, or you can select the discount code of one of the discounts intended for manual application. Discount Code The code of the line discount that has been applied to this line automatically. This column appears only if the Customer and Vendor Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Discount Sequence The identifier of a discount sequence that has been applied to this line. The column is hidden by default and available only if the Customer & Vendor Discounts feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Amount The amount calculated (after the discount has been taken) for the item. Alternate ID The alternate ID used for this inventory item-subitem pair by the vendor. For more information on using alternate IDs, see Item Cross-References. Tax Category The tax category assigned to the ordered non-stock item. Account The expense account used to record the purchased non-stock item that does not require receipt (by default, the account specified for the item in the Use COGS /Expense Account From box on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form). If needed, you can select the account manually. Description The description of the account used. Sub. From box on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes form). Base Order Qty. The quantity of the non-stock item ordered, expressed in the base unit of measure. Line Nbr. The number of the document line. The system regenerates this number automatically when you add lines to the table. Line Order The order number of the document line. Completed A check box that indicates (if selected) that the purchasing of the non-stock item requested by this line of the subcontract has been completed. Canceled A check box that indicates (if selected) that this line of the subcontract has been canceled. Manual Cost A check box that indicates (if selected) that the amount has been applied manually. Received Amt. The amount received by the subcontract line. Received Qty. The quantity received by the subcontract line. Validate Total on Entry A check box that indicates (if selected) that the system will require the user to validate the total amount for each subcontract. Mailing settings specified on this tab will be used as the default values for mailing settings specified for vendor classes, which in turn will be used as the default values for setting up mailings for particular vendors. row.PlainText: Subcontract Form ID: (SC641000) ([~/?ScreenId=SC641000|SC641000])By using this report, you can look through, print, and email the subcontracts created in the Subcontracts module. You can select a reference number of the particular subcontract you want to view. The subcontracts are displayed as they will be printed. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Subcontract Number : The number of the subcontract to be displayed. Select a number of the subcontract for which you want to build the report.

row.column: Subcontract Summary Form ID: (SC610500) ([~/?ScreenId=SC610500|SC610500])For a particular date range, this report shows summary information about the subcontracts that are neither closed nor canceled. The information presented for each subcontract includes the reference number, subcontract date, status, currency, vendor ID and name, ordered quantity, open quantity, line total, and open amount. The report also includes total values (for all subcontracts included in the report) for the ordered quantity, open quantity, line total, and open amount. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date of the date range to be reported on. A start date must be selected. End Date : The end date of the date range; an end date must be selected. Only the subcontracts having dates that fall within the specified interval will be included in the report. Vendor ID : The vendor for which you want to view subcontract information, by its ID. You can select a vendor to view only subcontracts created for this vendor, or leave the box blank to view a broader range of data. Inventory ID : The non-stock item for which you want to view subcontract information. Select the ID of the non-stock to view only subcontracts created for purchasing this item.

Subcontract Details by Vendor Form ID: (SC611000) ([~/?ScreenId=SC611000|SC611000])For a particular date range, this report displays detailed information about subcontracts that are neither closed nor canceled. The data in the report is grouped by the vendors for which the subcontracts were created. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date of the date range of the report; a start date must be specified. End Date : The end date of the date range; a date must be specified here as well. Only subcontracts having dates that fall within the specified interval will be included in the report. Vendor ID : The vendor for which you want to view subcontract information, by its ID. You can select a vendor to view only subcontracts created for this vendor, or leave the box blank to view a broader range of data. Inventory ID : The non-stock item for which you want to view subcontract information. Select the inventory ID of the non-stock item to view only subcontracts created for purchasing this item.
